import-definition.name: NJ PARCC Test Scores Import
import-definition.comment:
The NJ PARCC Test Scores Import is used to import data into Student Assessments. The requirements for the Assessment Definition are:
1) must contain a column for Assessment Year with the alias "PARCCTSTYEAR"
2) must contain a column for Assessment Period with the alias "PARCCTSTPERIOD"
3) must contain a column for Assessment Test Code with the alias "PARCCTSTCODE"
The input file must be a CSV file with headers. The header values are used to map fields in the input file to columns in the Student Assessment or columns in the Assessment Definition. Some of these mappings are defined as hidden fields in the input definition. These headings are all required in the input file.
Heading "StateStudentIdentifier" maps to "relAsmStdOid.stdIDState"
Heading "AssessmentYear" maps to field with the alias "PARCCTSTYEAR"
Heading "Period" maps to field with the alias "PARCCTSTPERIOD"
Heading "TestCode" maps to field with the alias "PARCCTSTCODE"
Heading "Unit1OnlineTestStartDateTime" maps to "asmDate"
The format for the date field is also contained in the input definition and is set to "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"
Any additional fields contained in the input file can be imported into Student Assessment fields or fields defined with assessment column definitions.
To import into Student Assessment fields, an alias must be added to the field consisting of the PARCC alias prefix and the column heading name. The PARCC alias prefix which is currently "PARCC_" is contained in the input definition. If the user wishes to populate the field asmScaleScore with values from the "TestScaleScore" column, the alias "PARCC_TestScaleScore" is added to the asmScaleScore field definition. There is no way to set the formatter used to import these fields. The standard converter will handle normal conversions other than date.
To import into a field defined with an Assessment column definition, the same mechanism can be used. Since this mechanism is limited to column headings with names 23 characters in length or shorter, an alternate way of mapping columns is included. An alias "all-acd-ImportHeading" can be defined on a 'C' field and populated with the input file heading. Placing a value in this field maps the data in the input column with this heading name to the defined field.
For fields defined with Assessment column definition, there is also a mechanism to add the format attribute for the imported field. This is commonly needed for date fields. An alias "all-acd-ImportHeading" is defined and the column format is placed in this field.
The match fields for this import are 1) Assessment OID, 2) Student State Identifier, 3) "PARCCTSTYEAR", 4) "PARCCTSTPERIOD", and 5) "PARCCTSTCODE". If an existing record matches these fields, its values are updated. If no match is found, a new record is created.

import-definition.name: NJ NJSLA Test Scores Import
import-definition.comment:
The NJ NJSLA Test Scores Import is used to import data into Student Assessments. The requirements for the Assessment Definition are:
1) must contain a column for Assessment Year with the alias "all-asm-AssessmentYear"
2) must contain a column for Assessment Period with the alias "all-asm-TestPeriod"
3) must contain a column for Assessment Test Code with the alias "all-asm-NJTestCode"
The input file must be a CSV file with headers. The header values are used to map fields in the input file to columns in the Student Assessment or columns in the Assessment Definition. Some of these mappings are defined as hidden fields in the input definition. These headings are all required in the input file.
Heading "StateStudentIdentifier" maps to "relAsmStdOid.stdIDState"
Heading "AssessmentYear" maps to field with the alias "all-asm-AssessmentYear"
Heading "Period" maps to field with the alias "all-asm-TestPeriod"
Heading "TestCode" maps to field with the alias "all-asm-NJTestCode"
Heading "Unit1OnlineTestStartDateTime" maps to "asmDate"
The format for the date field is also contained in the input definition and is set to "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"
Any additional fields contained in the input file can be imported into Student Assessment fields or fields defined with assessment column definitions.
To import into a field defined with an Assessment column definition, the same mechanism can be used. Since this mechanism is limited to column headings with names 23 characters in length or shorter, an alternate way of mapping columns is included. An alias "all-acd-ImportHeading" can be defined on a 'C' field and populated with the input file heading. Placing a value in this field maps the data in the input column with this heading name to the defined field.
For fields defined with Assessment column definition, there is also a mechanism to add the format attribute for the imported field. This is commonly needed for date fields. An alias "all-acd-ImportHeading" is defined and the column format is placed in this field.
The match fields for this import are 1) Assessment OID, 2) Student State Identifier, 3) "all-asm-AssessmentYear", 4) "all-asm-TestPeriod", and 5) "all-asm-NJTestCode". If an existing record matches these fields, its values are updated. If no match is found, a new record is created.
